locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the footwashing as a symbolic enactment of the Cross, contrasting it with human status-seeking and moralistic interpretations.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Correctly identifies the primary meaning as Christological/Soteriological rather than merely ethical.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the meaning of the text, but shifting toward promising and declaring in the final third.
voorbeelden: The primary meaning is that the Son of God is stooping down.
I chose you.
He is living and present with us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel humbled, cleansed, and drawn into the divine life without the burden of 'earning' status.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned: 'by the power of the Holy Spirit'.

voorbeelden: Jesus knew that his hour had come.
Human dinners almost always have this built-in competition.
The story burdened me.
Think of yourselves as Jesus' very own beloved disciples.
Do not go away without opening your heart.
Let us listen again.
It is particularly heartwarming to see young people.
That alarms me.
I remember the first time...
He loves us to the end.
He has brought you here to be with him.
He will bring us into his family forever.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong. The preacher uses the present tense to bind Christ's promise to the current moment.

voorbeelden: To each of you, a very special welcome from the Lord Jesus Christ himself.
He is clean all over.
Maundy Thursday and Good Friday will hold no terrors for you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate to High. The preacher speaks as a 'mandataris' of Christ in the welcome.

indicatoren: Extensive historical anecdotes about New York and Richmond.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual engagement and relatability, but delays the 'event' of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct absolution (I forgive you) could have strengthened the declarative force.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is addressed, but only after significant setup.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High. Uses the second person to apply the work of Christ directly.
voorbeelden: Christ himself has brought you here.
He loves us to the end.
His purifying grace so freely offered.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation as disciples.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the 'welcome' and the 'promise' of the meal.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, the disciples, and the world.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is bridged in the final section.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about human nature and sin.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids the 'Jesus died -> so work harder' trap.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Exegesis of footwashing) -> Commissive (Christ loves you to the end) -> Directive (Open your heart).
voorbeelden: The primary meaning is... (Assertive) -> He loves us to the end (Commissive) -> Do not go away without opening (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent. The imperative is strictly founded on the indicative of grace.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because you know that at their heart lies a greater promise... Do not go away without opening your heart.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon successfully moves from 'talking about' the text to 'performing' the welcome of Christ. It treats the Maundy Thursday service as a contemporary encounter with the living Lord.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ himself has brought you here to be with him.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The section on the New York parish and Richmond.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event because it claims Christ's presence ('He is here') and acts upon that claim.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strongly links the word to the physical elements of the Eucharist and the 'washing' of the Cross.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, the preacher explicitly channels Christ's welcome.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, 'a very special welcome from the Lord Jesus Christ himself'.
tekstueel_bewijs: To each of you, a very special welcome from the Lord Jesus Christ himself.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher invites the hearer to 'discover' what the Spirit is doing.
tekstueel_bewijs: He is living and present with us... by the power of the Holy Spirit.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is framed as part of the meal Christ 'arranged'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Tonight the Lord brings us close around his table.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is well-balanced but carries a heavy load of descriptive anecdotes that could be trimmed to allow the performative 'toezegging' to breathe more.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The primary meaning is that the Son of God is stooping down.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, the Son of God stoops down to you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a theological definition to a present-tense event.

voorbeeldzinnen: He loves you to the end.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Third-person narrative of Peter is slightly long.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave Peter's resistance with the congregation's resistance more quickly.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterful example of performative preaching that avoids moralism by grounding every directive in the declarative grace of Christ's humiliation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (the anecdotes), SAT reveals that the preacher's authority comes from the 'Declarative' mandate of Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the cleverness of the 'A list/B list' metaphor, but in the 'Commissive' act of Christ inviting the hearer to the table.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the sermon's climax is not the explanation of the Greek 'morphe', but the 'Declarative' welcome at the end.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He is living and present with us, as he promised.

appendices.notities: The preacher (Fleming Rutledge) uses a 'Constative' surplus in the middle to dismantle moralism, which justifies the length of the descriptive sections.
